definition: Classification describing whether a conservation-unit data series supports absolute abundance metrics (Abs_Abd) or only relative index metrics (RelIdx) in WSP workflows.
Percentile rank of current generational abundance relative to historical distribution.

definition: Age measured at maturity.
Age measured at return migration (adult return timing).
Age measured at the time of sampling or observation.
The reference event or life-history point that an age value is measured against.
Controlled vocabulary for the reference event used by an age value (for example, age at return).
A notation system used to encode salmon age values in stock assessment data.
Controlled vocabulary for salmon age notation systems (for example, Gilbert-Rich and European notation).
Dimensionless ratio of generational average abundance to a benchmark threshold used in WSP rapid-status logic.

definition: Bypass or breach risks not monitored and verified negligible
Classification/attribution not documented
Incomplete cross-section coverage
Measurement context indicating categorical or ordinal quality ratings.
Data models, analytical workflows, provenance, quality dimensions, and metadata supporting salmon science.
Detectability factors not validated
Device not within operational specifications
Missing SIL/SEN logs or QA/methods report
Criteria that may result in downgrading an escapement estimate type classification
Effort not standardized
Environmental conditions outside specifications
Classification of escapement estimate quality based on Hyatt 1997 framework
Salmon age notation that records freshwater years followed by ocean years (for example, 1.2).
Fishery openings, harvest control rules, catch/effort measures, and exploitation monitoring for salmon fisheries.
Mean spawner abundance across the most recent generation-length years used as the numerator for WSP benchmark ratios.

definition_source_text: Source documented in WSP integration proposal

definition: Genetic markers, assays, and analyses used to infer stock composition, parentage, and population structure.
Salmon age notation where total age is annotated with freshwater years as a subscript-like suffix (for example, 4_2 for total age 4 with 2 freshwater years).
Habitat attributes, ecosystem conditions, and climate or environmental stressors affecting salmon.
Interpolation used for missing data; defensibility must be documented
WSP long-term trend metric computed from trend-designated wild spawner series to support rapid status determination.

definition: MR assumptions not evaluated
A context qualifier used to disambiguate the interpretation of a measurement column.

Survey/analytical methods not adequately identified/consistent
Field observations, sampling protocols, survey events, gear, and measurement methods used to collect salmon data.
Insufficient number of survey visits
A measurement datum representing an empirically observed rate, count, or abundance derived from monitoring or survey data.
WSP percent-change metric measuring generational abundance change used in rapid status decision logic.

definition: Insufficient reach coverage
Insufficient QA review of automated events
Run-window coverage < 95% of season days
Hatchery production, broodstock management, releases, and enhancement program practices for salmon.
COSEWIC/SARA recovery planning, critical habitat, threats, and status assessments for species of conservation concern.
Stock assessment models, benchmarks, status determinations, and performance metrics for salmon units.

term_name: Target or limit rate or abundance
definition: A value specification representing a policy- or model-defined target or limit, such as TAC or UMSY.
Associates OWL classes and SKOS concepts with high-level thematic concept schemes (e.g., Stock Assessment, GSI, Policy).
High-level thematic concept scheme for organizing DFO Salmon Ontology classes and concepts.
Poor timing of surveys
Trap efficiency not measured/validated
Total, seasonal counts through fence or fishway; virtually no bypass. Simple, often single step analysis. Reliable resolution of between year differences >10% (in absolute units).
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: Indirect estimate of total spawner abundance with qualified accuracy and known precision (i.e., a variance estimate—an explicit quantitative measure of uncertainty around the estimate). Derived from high-effort, standardized methods (e.g., mark-recapture, serial counts for area under the curve) with documented analytical conversions (including interpolation/calibration as needed). Reported in absolute units (estimate ± variance). Reliable resolution of between-year differences >25% (in absolute units).
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: Relative abundance index (i.e., not an absolute count) derived from moderate to high effort surveys (typically 3 or more site visits) using standardized methods applied consistently between and within years (e.g., equal-effort surveys executed by walk, swim, overflight). Accuracy and precision are not fully quantified (i.e., no explicit variance estimate), but are assumed stable enough for within-series comparisons. Reliable resolution of between-year differences >25% (in relative units).
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: Low to moderate effort (1-4 trips), known survey method. Simple analysis by known methods. Reliable resolution of between year differences >200% (in relative units).
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: Low effort (e.g. 1 trip), use of vaguely defined, inconsistent or poorly executed methods. Unknown to ill defined; inconsistent or poorly executed. Uncertain numeric comparisons, but high reliability for presence or absence.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: Non-numeric, year-specific record of presence/not detected (i.e., present/absent without estimating a count), tied to an explicit time and location, with reliable species identification. Underlying field methods may be highly variable; analysis is not required.
related_terms: Escapement Estimate Type Scheme (inScheme) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateTypeScheme]; Estimate Type (broader) [https://w3id.org/gcdfo/salmon#EstimateType]

definition: Counting/device uptime < 95% (or <90% with interpolation)
Poor visibility conditions
Conservation Unit based stock assessment methods, metrics, and metadata
